title: ICE implementing Fn trait for unit struct

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

body:
The following programs generate the ICE with a slightly different message. May be related to #22565 and #22566 

``` rust
#![feature(unboxed_closures)]

pub struct Foo;

impl<A> Fn<(A,)> for Foo {
    type Output = ();
    extern "rust-call" fn call(&self, (_,): (A,)) {
    }
}

pub fn main() {
    println!("{:?}", Foo("bar"));
}
```

```

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
```

``` rust
#![feature(unboxed_closures)]

pub struct Foo;

impl<A> Fn<(A,)> for Foo {
    type Output = A;
    extern "rust-call" fn call(&self, (arg,): (A,)) -> A {
        arg
    }
}

pub fn main() {
    println!("{:?}", Foo("bar"));
}
```

